required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Contacting Authors to Retrieve Individual Patient Data
clinical_study.official_title: Contacting Authors to Retrieve Individual Patient Data: Protocol for a Randomized Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this study is to examine the impact of incentivizing authors of RCTs that are eligible for a systematic review and meta-analysis, versus usual contact strategies to obtain original IPD

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Authors Who Provided Complete IPD
primary_outcome.description: We contacted authors of eligible studies from June 2016 to October 2016. Authors were first contacted in June 2016, where we sent: a) an email requesting their IPD, b) email reminders (4 in total) at 2, 6, 10, and 14-week intervals after the initial email, c) reminders by post in week 7, and d) reminders via telephone in week 15.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time Taken to Obtain the IPD Between Initial Request and Authors' Provision
secondary_outcome.description: We contacted authors of eligible studies from June 2016 to October 2016. Authors were first contacted in June 2016, where we sent: a) an email requesting their IPD, b) email reminders (4 in total) at 2, 6, 10, and 14-week intervals after the initial email, c) reminders by post in week 7, and d) reminders via telephone in week 15.

secondary_outcome.measure: The Completeness of the IPD Received
secondary_outcome.description: We contacted authors of eligible studies from June 2016 to October 2016. Authors were first contacted in June 2016, where we sent: a) an email requesting their IPD, b) email reminders (4 in total) at 2, 6, 10, and 14-week intervals after the initial email, c) reminders by post in week 7, and d) reminders via telephone in week 15.

arm_group.description: Those allocated to the control group will be contacted by email, mail, and phone, but will not receive a financial incentive
Those allocated to the intervention group will be contacted by email, mail, and phone, and will be asked to provide the IPD from their RCT and they will be given a financial incentive.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Corresponding authors of RCTs included in our previous and updated systematic reviews
Exclusion Criteria:

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Authors identified in randomized controlled trials that were eligible for inclusion in two systematic review and network meta-analysis papers.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Authors whose contact information was unidentifiable were excluded.

group.title: No Incentive (Control)
group.description: Those allocated to the control group will be contacted using the same approaches as the intervention arm for their participation to share individual patient data of their study. No financial incentive is provided.

group.title: Financial Incentive (Intervention)
group.description: Those allocated to the intervention group will be contacted by email, mail, and phone to share individual patient data from their study. They will be given a financial incentive (an offer of a $100 CAD gift card at first contact (or equivalent amount in the authorâ€™s relevant currency) for their participation to share individual patient data of their study).

baseline.population: Baseline data not collected on any participants

group.title: No Incentive
group.description: Those allocated to the control group will be contacted by email, mail, and phone, but will not receive a financial incentive

group.title: Incentive
group.description: Those allocated to the intervention group will be contacted by email, mail, and phone, and will be asked to provide the IPD from their RCT and they will be given a financial incentive. Financial Incentive: money

measure.title: Race and Ethnicity Not Collected
measure.population: Race and Ethnicity were not collected from any participant.

outcome.title: Proportion of Authors Who Provided Complete IPD
outcome.description: We contacted authors of eligible studies from June 2016 to October 2016. Authors were first contacted in June 2016, where we sent: a) an email requesting their IPD, b) email reminders (4 in total) at 2, 6, 10, and 14-week intervals after the initial email, c) reminders by post in week 7, and d) reminders via telephone in week 15.
outcome.population: None of the authors in either arm shared individual patient data from their study.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
